tweet: Today I met with @Amb_AlThani of #Qatar.  I urged Qatar to focus on efforts to prevent Saudi Arabia from gaining a nuclear weapon and I emphasized that Qatar must also press Hamas to stop attacks on Israel. pic.twitter.com/ULdQ6tunkr

It was great meeting with Indonesia's Ambassador Mahendra Siregar today. We discussed the South China Sea, Afghanistan, Hamas, and how to expand and create a more balanced trading relationship between our two countries. pic.twitter.com/m3c7DH0sOK

Best thing #SCOTUS has done in quite a while. #Census2020

I met with Mr. Hanscom Smith, the incoming @USAinHKMacau. It is critical to support Hong Kong's autonomy and prosperity. China cannot have a prosperous #HongKong without upholding human rights and the rule of law in Hong Kong. pic.twitter.com/LneJFI1M9x

The 12 year sentence is outrageous and I urge President Nguyen Phu Trong to pardon Michael Nguyen. While he remains in prison Americans will need to think twice before they spend their tourist dollars , or invest , in Vietnam. https://cbsn.ws/2Frftor
The @FAANews must do much more to immediately address the concerns of our communities. 2/2

Our amendment to the Transportation funding bill directing the @FAANews to prioritize combating airplane and helicopter noise was approved by the House of Representatives. The amendment was offered by myself, @EleanorNorton and a number of our colleagues. 1/2

Today I met with and congratulated two of my talented constituents, Harmeen Dhariwal and Maisha Khanum, for receiving the Congressional Award Gold Medal. This award recognizes young Americans who demonstrate a strong commitment towards public service in their communities. pic.twitter.com/Jn8KrBjP5s

Today I met with Moon Chung-in & South Korean lawmakers & diplomats. We were joined by my colleagues @RepTedYoho and @RepEdCase. We discussed the best way forward on the North Korean nuclear issue & holding family reunions between Americans and their relatives inside North Korea. pic.twitter.com/GwnGRtZfkt
We will continue to protect millions of families from these fear-based policies -- including many tens of thousands of families who are very much part of our San Fernando Valley Community. 2/2

Tonight, he will begin his campaign for re-election by promising to deport “millions”. 1/2 https://lat.ms/2XS2ZgQ

The path to stability in #Sudan should not go through the military. I was pleased to join with @RepDanKildee in introducing a Resolution condemning attacks on peaceful protesters and supports a peaceful transition to a civilian-led democratic government in Sudan. #StandWithSudan
The @HouseForeign Subcommittee on Asia & the Pacific convened an important hearing today to discuss vital U.S. interests in South Asia. Watch what I had to say here: http://bit.ly/2wTEX9a

Today I grilled Assistant Secretary Clarke Cooper of the Bureau of Political-Military Affairs for the State Department on the constitutionality of the Trump administration's arms sales to Saudi Arabia. You can find the full exchange here: https://youtu.be/sS71lk8jhpo

Today I met with his excellency @BelovedAden, Ambassador of Yemen to the United States. We discussed the conflict in Yemen and how the atrocities committed by the Houthis should garner more media attention. We must all work to bring peace to Yemen. pic.twitter.com/hb0sigTT1h

It was a pleasure to meet with
Ambassador Cooper, #Australia’s Deputy of Mission. We discussed a range of topics relating to the alliance of our two countries, including working together to improve the lives of Pacific Islanders. pic.twitter.com/mNh33beCy2

We stand in solidarity with #HongKong as over 1 million people peacefully protest against an #ExtraditionBill that lets “suspected criminals” be deported to mainland China. https://www.wsj.com/articles/massive-crowds-take-to-streets-in-last-fight-for-hong-kong-11560075915 …

On National Gun Violence Awareness Day, #WeWearOrange to remember those who have lost their lives to gun violence. I was proud to have helped pass a universal background checks bill in the House. We must continue to fight for common sense measures to #EndGunViolence. pic.twitter.com/8CTCZ4St8V
Today I was happy to meet with Dr. George Balfour, Dr. Ronald Navarro and Dr. Rachel Goldstein of @AAOS1 to discuss legislation to improve patient care. pic.twitter.com/AbyvibZXK6

75 years ago today, thousands of brave Allied forces landed in France to liberate a continent from tyranny.  We must always recognize the courage and spirit of these incredible service members by continuing to advance the promise of freedom and democracy. #DDay75thAnniversary
On this solemn anniversary, we honor the fallen freedom fighters and all who work to advance their legacy. We will never allow their dreams and aspirations to be forgotten. #Tiananmen30 2/2
30 years ago today in Tiananmen Square, the Chinese Communist Party massacred its own people as they stood up for the dignity and human rights that they deserve. 1/2
Today I had the opportunity to address the bright and talented students at the @agbumds commencement ceremony. I wish the entire graduating class continued success. pic.twitter.com/2z0e9uqsfg
I had the pleasure to speak at Shomrei Torah synagogue this morning about Israel, Iran, Saudi Arabia and fighting anti-semitism in college campuses. pic.twitter.com/C1VfF9zgNG
